snippet: The Congressional Budget Office said the 2013 fiscal deficit would fall to about $642 billion, or 4 percent of G.D.P., about $200 billion less than it estimated just three months ago.
abstract: Congressional Budget Office says the 2013 fiscal deficit will fall to about $642 billion, about $200 billion lower than it estimated just three months ago; but experts warn there is a darker side to the brighter outlook for the deficit, saying the immediate spending cuts and tax increases Congress agreed to for this year are serving as a partial brake on the recovery, cutting government jobs and preventing growth from accelerating to a more robust pace.
lead_paragraph: The Congressional Budget Office said the 2013 fiscal deficit would fall to about $642 billion, or 4 percent of G.D.P., about $200 billion less than it estimated just three months ago.

headline.main: U.S. Budget Deficit Shrinks Far Faster Than Expected
headline.print_headline: Budget Deficit Shrinks Faster Than Expected
